data.title: Derek Fisher Research Paper - 655 Words
data.meta_description: When you were a kid did you ever sit on your rear end and daydreamed about being in the NBA, and earning millions of dollars each year? Well when Derek...
data.text:
History Of The Lakers

650 Words | 3 Pages

The Lakers are in the state capitol to battle the Sacramento Kings. Both teams are seeking their first win of the year, after losing to the T-Wolves and Clippers respectively. The top two picks in the NBA Draft (Karl Anthony – Towns and D’Angelo Russell) squared off in their regular-season debuts for the first time in the 50-year common draft era. Kobe Bryant dropped 24 points on the T-Wolves in the first game of his 20th season, while breaking Utah Jazz guard John Stockton’s NBA record for most seasons with one team.

Los Angeles Lakers Research Papers

517 Words | 3 Pages

When the Lakers moved to L.A. they became the first NBA team on the West Coast (Los Angeles Lakers). Despite their being no lakes anywhere in L.A., the Lakers decided to retain their name (Los Angeles Lakers). Their very first season in L.A., the Lakers finished in second place with a 36-43 record, beating the Detroit Pistons in the playoffs, but losing to the St. Louis Hawks in the Western Finals (Los Angeles Lakers). The Lakers have housed some of basketballs greatest players, including Kareem Abdul-Jabar, Elgin Baylor, Wilt Chamberlain, Magic Johnson, Karl Malone, Dennis Rodman and Jerry West, all of whom are just a few of the Lakers 23 Hall of Famers (Los Angeles Lakers).

1522 Words | 7 Pages

Therefore,Derek Jeter is famous because of his unique feats as the H.S.Player of the Year New York Yankees shortstop and much more. Derek Jeter that setting high goals ,finding a good person to look up to, challenging yourself , not being afraid to fail and much more would get him to his status of what he is today. Magic Johnson Research Paper

1776 Words | 8 Pages

Earvin had a very humble beginning as a young child, but his escape would be to watch and play basketball. Earvin’s mother would help him to learn the 5 pointers of basketballs and how to get a nice solid work ethic at a very young age. Also, Christine Johnson grew up playing basketball with her two older brothers and she fell in love with the game as well. Earvin would look up to the NBA most elite players at the time, as in Bill Russell, an 11 time NBA Champion; Marques Haynes, a very flashy Harlem Globetrotter; and Earl “The Pearl” Monroe, a New York Knicks

Ray Allen: Adequate 3-Point Player In The NBA

367 Words | 2 Pages

Then, in 5 years he went to the Miami Heat and became a 2 time champion so he played for them for 2 years and then he was 40 years old and retired.

Michael Jordan Major Accomplishments

458 Words | 2 Pages

This did not last long as he signed with the Bulls once again in 1995. Jordan retired at the end of his 2003 season because of a knee

Film Analysis: Hoop Dreams

416 Words | 2 Pages

The movie Hoop Dreams centered on a pair of intercity youths, William Gates and Arthur Agee. Both of them lived in the projects surrounding Chicago. Their families were economically and educationally disadvantaged. William and Arthur had almost everything imaginable trying to prevent their success. However, they shared a dream of playing in NBA.

Walt Chamberlain's Life And Accomplishments

473 Words | 2 Pages

Wilt Chamberlain was an all-star basketball player who was born in the year of 1936. He was a resident of Philadelphia born into a family with nine children. Wilt Chamberlain started his basketball career at Shoemaker Junior High school. He also played at his local playground against older players who gave him tips about the game of basketball. In Chamberlain’s high school career, he scored more than 2,200 points over three seasons.

Lamar Odom Persuasive Speech

443 Words | 2 Pages

Growing up, he lost both his parents. His father was a heroin addict while his mother died after getting colon cancer. Raised by his grandmother, Lamar seems to have taken to his father. His two closest friends passed away this year from drug-related causes. It seems the drug use sneaked it’s dirty entrails all around the NBA star’s life.

Louis Jordan Essay

771 Words | 4 Pages

He was born on July 8th,1908 and raised in Brinkley, Arkansas. His father was Jim Jordan, a bandleader and music teacher. His mother Adell died when he was very young. He learned the clarinet under the authority of his father at the age of seven. When they were walking past a music store he spotted a saxophone and he saved up money to buy it.

7ft Nowitzki Research Paper

386 Words | 2 Pages

Dirk Werner Nowitzki is a German professional basketball player of the National Basketball Association and member of the team Dallas Mavericks. Nowitzki was chosen as ninth pick in the 1998 NBA draft by the Milwaukee Bucks and suddenly traded to the Mavericks where he never left. Talking about greatest power forwards of all-times, 7ft Nowitzki is one of the conversation. In his early years, Nowitzki was born in Wurzburg, Germany.

Although many have not heard his name, George Mumford was the mastermind behind some of the NBA’s biggest moments. Although fans of the NBA (National Basketball Association) can recall the league's most exciting plays, many fail to see how Mumford’s lessons on mindfulness behind the scenes made them possible. Growing up George Mumford had the identical dream of thousands of kids across the United States; to play in the NBA. Unfortunately, he struggled with back problems early on in his college career, and later fought with alcohol addiction. These struggles forced Mumford to make his mark in the NBA in a different way.

Kareem Abdul Jabbar Essay

508 Words | 3 Pages

In 1975 young Kareem decided milwaukee wasn 't able to suite his cultural needs and demanded a trade. Kareem was then traded to the Los Angeles Lakers. Although the Lakers didn’t make it over .500 or make the playoffs Kareem still won his fourth mvp award, leading the league in rebounds (16.9) and blocks (4.12). In 1977-78 Kareem lost his temper and lashed out breaking his hand on Bucks rookie center Kent Benson 's face.

Raymone James Research Paper

1024 Words | 5 Pages

LeBron Raymone James is an American professional basketball player for the Cleveland Cavaliers (NBA). He starts at the small forward and power-forward positions. James has won two NBA championships, four of NBA’s most valuable players awards, two NBA finals MVP awards, two olympic gold medals, an NBA scoring title, and the NBA rookie of the year award. He has also been selected to 12 NBA all-star games, and is the Cleveland Cavaliers leading scorer. With all this success he must have had personal trainers and great coaches as a kid, but that is not true.
